description: Now comes one of the harder parts. Let's observe whether the rubber strip is broken so that we know when to send out an event!

We'll add an observer and an observer function. You can observe a property by adding "observer: '_breakStrip'" to the property. Of course, it requires us to have a function _breakStrip in the class. For now, this can remain empty.
followUpMessage: Nice, huh? Every time the boolean value of _isBroken changes, the function _breakStrip will be called. When this happens, we should fire an event! Let's try that!

minifiedJavaScriptSolutions: class RubberStrip extends Polymer.Element{static get is(){return'rubber-strip'}static get properties(){return{side:{type:String,value:''},_isBroken:{type:Boolean,value:!1,observer:'_breakStrip'}}}ready(){super.ready();self.setInterval(this._stretch,7e3)}_breakStrip(){}_stretch(){!this._isBroken&&Math.random()>.8&&(this._isBroken=!0)}}window.customElements.define(RubberStrip.is,RubberStrip)

exercises.template:
<link rel="import" href="lib/polymer/polymer-element.html">
<link rel="import" href="leather-pouch.html">
<link rel="import" href="rubber-strip.html">
<link rel="import" href="handle.html">
<link rel="import" href="rock.html">

<dom-module id="slingshot">
    <template>
        <rock></rock>
        <leather-pouch></leather-pouch>
        <rubber-strip side="[[_leftSide]]"></rubber-strip>
        <rubber-strip side="[[_rightSide]]"></rubber-strip>
        <handle></handle>
    </template>
</dom-module>

<script>
    class Slingshot extends Polymer.Element {

        static get is() {
            return 'slingshot';
        }

        static get properties() {
            return {
                _leftSide: {
                    type: String,
                    value: 'Left',
                },
                _rightSide: {
                    type: String,
                    value: 'Right',
                },
                _readyToFire: {
                    type: Boolean,
                    value: false,
                },
            };
        }

        ready() {
            super.ready();

            this._readyToFire = true;
            self.setInterval(this._fire, 6000);
        }

        _fire() {
            if(this._readyToFire) {
                console.log('Fire away!!');
            }
        }
    }

    window.customElements.define(Slingshot.is, Slingshot);
</script>
